result.execSummary:
The defendant Mercedes N Kelsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs waived.

Credit in the event of revocation: 1 day

Sign up for probation today.

Pursuant to sec. 973.015 Wisconsin Statutes, upon successful completion of probation, Defendant is eligible for expungement of this record and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedes N Kelsey

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Mercedes N Kelsey.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick provides the court with the plea questionnaire. Attorney Harper moves to amend to 947.01(1)  for 1 year probation plus costs. Court goes over the plea questionnaire form. Court finds a factual basis.  

Court amends to 947.01(1). MK enters a NC plea. Attorney Burdick heard.


Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 1 year.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs waived.
Credit in the event of revocation: 1 day
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today.

Pursuant to sec. 973.015 Wisconsin Statutes, upon successful completion of probation, Defendant is eligible for expungement of this record and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure.

3:32 PM Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey not in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Mercedes N Kelsey.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick states that MK has informed her that she has moved to Milwaukee. Attorney Burdick states that this case is resolved and asks for a plea and sentencing date. Attorney Harper asks for a warrant but stayed. Court states that the defendant hasn't updated her address. Court authorizes a warrant but stayed. Court removes the trial date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:35 PM Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey not in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Mercedes N Kelsey. Attorney Burdick states that MK is in the parking lot but has had close contact with COVID. 

Attorney Burdick is still working on the case and tentatively will have a resolution.

Court adjust hearing dates. Jury selection on 10/19/22. On day jury trial will be on either 10/20/22 or 10/21/22.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:12 AM Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video means for Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey appeared by phone means. Attorney Burdick has received the complaint and waives the formal reading and would like to move forward with the arraignment. Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick stands mute for the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:11 PM Defendant Mercedes N Kelsey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. MK hasn't received the complaint. Court speaks about counsel. Court advises the defendant to call the public defenders office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No "notice posting  cash bond" form was filled out at dispatch.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Walmart or that person's residence and is not to go to 2401 US HWY 14, Richland Center, WI 53581.
